alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Meigs, southwestern Washington, southeastern Athens, northeastern Jackson and Wood Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Washington, or near Coolville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Athens, Belpre, Coolville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Washington, Mineralwells, Tuppers Plains, Boaz, Lubeck, North Hills, Amesville, Belleville, Reedsville, Walker, Stroud Run State Park, Little Hocking, Fleming and Blennerhassett. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 151 and 183. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
